Adv Units Guide One.name: Adv Units Guide One
sections: There are ten military units available in Clash of Clans ranging from the Barbarian to the PEKKA.  Although it may be tempting to only consider building higher level units for your army, the best army are actually a mix of units that incorporate a good balance between ranged and melee units.  The following section will detail each unit and how they can be used in conjunction with other units in order to maximize the effectiveness of your army.

The most basic unit is the Barbarian.  Despite being a tier one unit, the Barbarian is very versatile and can fit into many armies due to the low housing space each unit takes up.  Barbarians have a decent amount of hit points, but also has one of highest DPS units available in the game.  This is due the fact that Barbarians only take up one housing space.  Four Barbarian do almost as much damage as a single Wizard, but also have much greater total hit points (4 Barbarians and 1 Wizard take the same housing space).

The second tier unit is the Archer.  Like the Barbarian, the Archer is a high DPS unit that also has the advantage of having a ranged attack.  Despite having really low hp, Archers are very useful against none area of effect based defenses such as the Cannon and the Archer Tower.  Massing Archers against opponents who only have a single Mortar can generally lead to a swift victory.  When your opponents have a lot of Mortars and Wizard Towers, Archers become much less useful unless you couple them with some high hp units such as the Giant.

The third tier unit is the Goblin.  Goblins have low hit points and average DPS, but they are useful for attacking resource buildings.  These units will do extra damage to any Gold Storage, Gold Mine, Elixir Storage and Elixir Collector that they encounter.  If you are planning to loot a lot resources from an opponents, having a few Goblins in your army can make all the difference.

The fourth tier unit is the Giant.  Giants take up a total of 5 housing space, but in return have a huge amount of hit points (300 at level one).  These units deal very little damage, but they have an important role in any army.  Due to their large amount of hit points, Giants can take a lot of punishment and are especially good at absorbing hits from area effect based defense buildings such as the Mortar and the Wizard Tower.  Having just a few Giants as your front line units will make most attacks much more effective.

The fifth tier unit is the Wall Breaker.  Unlike other units, Wall Breakers only make one attack by sacrificing themselves.  As their name implies, Wall Breakers target enemy walls first and foremost.  They do huge damage to Walls and can destroy most walls in one attack.  If your opponent has strong Walls, sending in one or two Wall Breakers at the beginning of an attack can be an effective strategy.

Stay tuned for part 2 of this guide which will have detailed info about the higher tier units.

Fast Build Order.name: Fast Build Order
sections:
The game begins with a guided tutorial which sets up your basic base
with a Townhall, a Gold Mine, an Elixir Collector, a Barracks, an Army
Camp and a Cannon.  You are also forced to get a second builder to
which costs 250 of your starting 500 crystals.  After this initial
phase, you are free to build your base however you see fit.

Since you cannot be attacked during the newbie period of 72 hours, the
most important tasks at this point are to build up your resource
collection and storage levels in order to upgrade your Townhall to the
maximum level before coming out of newbie protection.  The goal during
this period is to get your Townhall to level 4 before your 3 days of
protection are up.

Initially, you will have very low gold and elixir storage which will
prevent you from utilizing all the resources you collect, so
prioritize getting your Gold Storage and Elixir Storage buildings to
level 3 each.  Also, build and upgrade your second set of Gold Storage
and Elixir Storage as soon you get your Townhall to level 3.  The core
of this strategy lies in building up your Townhall as fast as
possible, so you should always be upgrading your Gold Storage until
you have enough capacity of gold to get the next Townhall upgrade.
You shouldn't spend too much gold on Elixir Storage because that will
slow you down from building up your Townhall.

Low level Gold Mines and Elixir Collectors are also a bottleneck when
you first start up.  Gold Mines and Elixir Collectors at lower levels
have very low of storage capacity which means that you'll have to log
on very often to dump the resources into your storage buildings.
Optimally you'll want to upgrade both of the collection buildings to
level 5 as you get the resources to do so.  Upgrading beyond level 5
at this stage of the game is counter productive because the amount of
the resource you get per hour does not increases very much beyond
level 5 compared to the amount of time and resources you need to put
in for the upgrade.  During protection you probably don't want to
upgrade your Elixir Collectors beyond level 4 because that will take a
lot of gold away from upgrading your Townhall and slowdown your
overall progress

You will notice that you won't have the necessary gold and elixir to
build all the buildings that you want and to upgrade them to the
minimum desired level.  To prevent this lack of resources in becoming
a bottleneck, you can either spend crystals (which you shouldn't spend
early on if you don't intend to spend money on the game) or you can
play the single player game to obtain resources by attacking goblin
camps.  In order to facilitate a fast start where you always have
enough resources to fund your base, you should as many Barracks and
Army Camps as you can.  You don't need to upgrade the Barracks at all
because Barbarians are sufficient for handling the early single player
missions.  Also, you can run with level 1 Army Camps, but I would
recommend upgrading them to level 2 because the cost is relatively
cheap in terms of build time and elixir cost.  To loot the resources
from the goblin camps, just create as many Barbarians as you can to
fill up all the space in your Army Camps and then send them all in for
the next mission of the map.  You cannot loot each goblin camp more
than once, so always do the next available camp that you have not done
before.  If you don't manage to clear a camp in one attack, you can
always do another attack to get the rest of the resources.

Adv Base Defense One.name: Adv Base Defense One
sections: Building a strong defense is a vital skill in Clash of Clans, because if you can't hold on to your trophies, then your score will not increase no matter how many attacks you are able to make.  On top of that, if your defense is weak, you will find it hard to accumulate resources in order to upgrade your defenses and other buildings.  This guide is split into three parts, the first part of this guide will be focused on the usage of and placement of defense buildings such as the Cannon and the Wizard Tower.

The most basic defense building you can construct is the Cannon.  This defense building has a basic attack with a range of 9 tiles and does a moderate amount of single target damage.  The Cannon is good against most units, but will not be able to hold off most attacks by itself.  To maximize the effectiveness of your Cannons, you should back them up with higher tier defense buildings or put a lot Cannons next to each other so that they can defend each other.  Cannons cannot hit air units, so it is crucial to have each Cannon covered by at least one defense building that can attack air units.  Otherwise, your Cannon will be sniped easily by a single Balloon.

The second tier defense building is the Archer Tower.  Archer Towers have very similar starts compared to Cannons, except that Archer Towers can hit air units and also have a slightly higher range of 10 tiles.  These buildings have good single target DPS, but lack the ability to take out massed armies of Barbarians or Archers.  Its a good idea to bunch up Archer Towers with Cannons in order to increase the overlapping coverage of your defenses or to put a Wizard Tower next to your Archer Tower to prevent is from being overwhelmed by a mass of lower tier units.

The third tier defense building is the Mortar.  This is the first defense building that has an area of effect attack which makes it the most important early defense building to get.  Due to the effectiveness of the Mortar, it is much more expensive to construct and upgrade than the Archer Tower and the Cannon.   Also, until you have upgraded your Townhall to level 6, you will only be able to construct a single Mortar.  Mortars are good against groups of lower tier units such as Barbarians and Archers, however they cannot hit air units so it is a good idea to cover them with at least one anti air defense building.  You will also want to put Mortars near the center of your defensive formation so that they can cover the most likely attack routes.

The fourth tier defense the Air Defense.  These buildings serve only one purpose: to kill air units.  Air Defenses are extremely effective against air units such as Balloons, because they have extremely high DPS.  In exchange for high DPS against air units, these buildings cannot hit ground units at all.  To maximize the effectiveness of your Air Defenses, you will want to cover them with other anti ground defense buildings so you don't lose your Air Defense to a few well placed ground units.

The fifth tier defense is the Wizard Tower.  Wizard Towers fit the same role as Mortars by doing high amounts of area of effect damage.  These buildings are even more expensive than Mortars, but also do much higher damage over time and are effective against both ground and air units.  The one weakness of these defense buildings is that they have a relatively short range of 7 which makes the area that they can cover relatively small compared to the Mortar.  To maximize the effectiveness of your Wizard Towers, its best to use them to cover another important defense building such as a Mortar or an Air Defense.

Stay tuned for the next part of this guide which will cover the Hidden Tesla and traps.

Giant Bomb - 1.name: Giant Bomb
Giant Bomb - 1.description: Single use trap that deals area of effect damage when a unit walks too close.  Only hits ground units.

Archer Tower - 1.name: Archer Tower
Archer Tower - 1.description: Single target base defense building with significant range.  The Archer Tower is the second tier base defense building.

Cannon - 1.name: Cannon
Cannon - 1.description: Single target base defense building with significant range.  The Cannon is the first tier base defense building.

Spring Trap - 1.name: Spring Trap
Spring Trap - 1.description: Single use trap that deals instantly kills any unit that has stepped on it.  The Spring Trap can kill any unit including the most powerful units, but only works against ground units.

Mortar - 1.name: Mortar
Mortar - 1.description: Area of effect long ranged base defense building.  The Mortar is effective against groups of ground units, but cannot hit air units.

Bomb - 1.name: Bomb
Bomb - 1.description: Single use trap that deals area of effect damage when a unit walks too close.  Only hits ground units.

Wall - 1.name: Wall
Wall - 1.description: Defense structure used to block attackers from getting to your other buildings.  Walls have high hit points, but cannot attack.

Hidden Tesla - 1.name: Hidden Tesla
Hidden Tesla - 1.description: Most powerful base defense available.  The Hidden Tesla is invisible to attacking players and will activate when an unit gets too close.  This building is able to attack both ground and air units.

Air Defense - 1.name: Air Defense
Air Defense - 1.description: Base defense building that can only attack air units.  Extremely effective against air units with single target DPS.

Wizard Tower - 1.name: Wizard Tower
Wizard Tower - 1.description: Area of effect medium ranged base defense building.  The Wizard Tower is effective against groups of both ground and air units, but has relatively short range compared to other base defenses.

Barracks - 1.name: Barracks
Barracks - 1.description: These buildings are where you can train army units.  The level of this building will determine the type of unit that can be trained.  Higher level Barracks also allow more units to be queued up for training.

Elixir Storage - 1.name: Elixir Storage
Elixir Storage - 1.description: This building stores elixir.  Your maximum amount of elixir cannot exceed the total storage amount you have across all of your Elixir Storages.

Clan Castle - 1.name: Clan Castle
Clan Castle - 1.description: The Clan Castle is a special building that exists on the starting plot of land for each player.  It can only be used once you have rebuilt it.  Once it is finished, this building allows you to join a clan or to create one.  Once you are part of a clan, you can request reinforcements which will help your defenses when you are attacked.

Elixir Collector - 1.name: Elixir Collector
Elixir Collector - 1.description: The Elixir Collector produces one of the two resources used in Clash of Clans.  This building collects elixir every hour and can store a set amount of elixir depending on the building level.

Builder's Hut - 1.name: Builder's Hut
Builder's Hut - 1.description: Each Builder's Hut provides one builder.  You can only build a maximum of five of theses buildings.  These buildings can only be purchased using crystals and cannot be constructed using gold or elixir.

Spell Factory - 1.name: Spell Factory
Spell Factory - 1.description: The Spell Maker lets you create spells which you can use in attacks.  The level of this building determines the maximum number of spells you can have at any one time and also the types of spells that can be created.

Gold Storage - 1.name: Gold Storage
Gold Storage - 1.description: This building stores gold.  Your maximum amount of gold at any one time cannot exceed the total storage amount you have across all of your Gold Storages.

Laboratory - 1.name: Laboratory
Laboratory - 1.description: This building allows you to research upgrades for your units.  Units can only be upgraded to a maximum level determined by the level of the Laboratory.

Army Camp - 1.name: Army Camp
Army Camp - 1.description: Army Camps provide housing space for your units.  These buildings limit the maximum number of units you can send on each attack.

Gold Mine - 1.name: Gold Mine
Gold Mine - 1.description: The Gold Mine produces one of the two resources used in Clash of Clans.  This building collects gold every hour and can store a set amount of gold depending on the level of the building.

Healer - 1.description: Fragile flying unit that heals other units.  The Healer does not attack buildings, but instead has an area of effect heal ability that will extend the lifetime of your other units.
Healer - 1.name: Healer

Giant - 1.description: Heavy front line unit.  The Giant is a highly durable melee unit that prefers to attack defense buildings.
Giant - 1.name: Giant

Balloon - 1.description: Flying unit that is highly effective against base defenses.  The Balloon targets base defenses first while ignoring other buildings.
Balloon - 1.name: Balloon

Wizard - 1.description: Extremely high damage ranged unit.  The Wizard does very high damage, but is extremely fragile.
Wizard - 1.name: Wizard

Dragon - 1.description: Highly damaging flying unit.  The Dragon is the second most powerful unit with high damage and a large number of hit points.
Dragon - 1.name: Dragon

Archer - 1.description: Basic ranged unit.  The Archer has relatively high damage but is very fragile.
Archer - 1.name: Archer

Wall Breaker - 1.description: Specialized unit for attacking walls.  The Wall Breaker will sacrifice itself to destroy the nearest wall.
Wall Breaker - 1.name: Wall Breaker

P.E.K.K.A - 1.description: Strongest melee unit in the game.  The PEKKA has high durability and high damage, but also takes up a lot of housing space and takes a long time to train.
P.E.K.K.A - 1.name: P.E.K.K.A

Barbarian - 1.description: Basic melee unit.  The Barbarian has relatively high damage and is effectively in large numbers.
Barbarian - 1.name: Barbarian

Goblin - 1.description: Fast and fragile melee unit.  Goblins are good at looting resources and will attack resource buildings first while dealing extra damage to them.
Goblin - 1.name: Goblin

Starting Up.name: Starting Up
sections:
Clash of Clans revolves around building and defending a town in the
same fashion as most tower defense games.  The player can construct
buildings, train units and create defenses in a progressively
expanding town that can eventually be attacked by other players.  The
main objective of the game is to win battles by destroying enemy towns
while defending your own town from enemy attacks.

There are three main resources used in the game which are Gold, Elixir
and Builders.  Gold is used to construct defenses, upgrade the
Townhall and constructing elixir related buildings such as the Elixir
Collector.  Elixir is used in training units, researching unit
upgrades, constructing various buildings including the Gold Mine and
Army Camp.  Builders are a limited resources that lets the player
construct or upgrade buildings.

To defend against attacks, players can construct defenses such as the
Cannon and the Archer Tower while using the other buildings as walls
to deter attackers from killing the town's Townhall or to prevent
attackers from looting the resources stored in the storage and
collection buildings within a town.

To attack other towns, players can train a variety of units to build
an army.  Attacking also revolves around carefully deployment of your
army during each attack to maximize the damage that you inflict.  By
successfully attacking and destroying enemy towns, players collect
trophies which is the score keeping system used in the game.

The objective of Clash of Clans is to collect as many trophies as
possible by successfully defending your town against other players
while at the same time succeed at destroying enemy towns with
progressively stronger units and larger armies.

Research and Spells.name: Research and Spells
sections:
You may find that basic units become insufficent to win many of the
battles you face as you progess in the game.  To overcome these
difficulties, you can upgrade your units by using the Laboratory or
you can create spells in the Spell Factory.

Researching upgrades for your units requires elixir and will generally
take a large amount of time as well.  Upgrading your units grants them
more hit points and more damage.  Lower level upgraded units may
become better than even higher level units depending on what you have
researched.  The level of research will be limited by the level of the
Laboratory.

To overcome base defenses, you can also create spells in the Spell
Factory.  Each spell you create will cost gold and can only be used
once.  The number of spells that you can store at any one time is
dependent on the level of the Spell Factory.  Higher level spells also
require the Spell Factory to be upgraded in order to create them.

For more information regarding spells and research, check out the
Extras section of the guide.

Units and Army.name: Units and Army
sections:
The most effective way to accumlate trophies in Clash of Clans is to
attack other players.  To do this, you will have to create an army by
training units in the Barracks building.  The available units in the
game are Barbarian, Archer,
Goblin, Giant, Wall Breaker, Balloon, Wizard, Healer, Dragon and PEKKA.

Each units costs elixir to train and will require a certain amount of
housing space to be available.  More powerful units will cost more
elixir, take more time to train and generally will take more housing
space, but will also be much more effective in battles.  High level
units can only be trained when the Barracks have been upgraded and
each level of the Barracks corresponds to the maximum level of unit
that can be trained within that Barracks.  The maximum army that you
can have participate in a battle depends on the level and number of
Army Camps that you have constructed within your town.

Each unit has its own strengths and weaknesses.  Some units deal high
damage while other units are good at taking hits.  Units may also
possess special abilities such as the ability to heal other units.  A
few units are designed to attack specific buildings and will tend to
do higher damage to the buildings that they specialize in attacking.

For the exact details of each units, check out the detailed unit
descriptions and stats available in the Units section of this guide.

Attacking.name: Attacking
sections:
Sick of getting your town destroyed by other players?  Return the
favor by attacking them back!

Once you have built up an army, you can deploy the army to attack
other towns.  If you succeed, you will be awarded with trophies and
loot.  To initiate an attack, click on the Attack button and then
choose an opponent.  You can either attack computer controlled towns
that compose the single player campaign or you can attack other
players.  Attacking other players will cost a small amount of gold
because finding other towns to attack comes with a scouting fee.

When you have found a suitable target, simply begin the attack by
selecting a unit and send it in by tapping an empy location on the
map.  You can send as many units as you have available in your army or
you can hold some back in case the battle is going bad or you think
you can win without using all the units.  Units can be spawned
anywhere on the map except within 2 tiles of an enemy building.  This
is prevent players from bypassing te defenses associated with a town.

Units that you spawn will act according to the behavior associated
with that unit which in most cases means attacking the nearest
building.  Some units will prioritize defenses while other units will
attack the first building that they encounter. To get the best
results, you should mix and match your units to create a balanced
army.

If you win the battle, you will be rewarded with trophies and loot.
However, if you don't do enough damage to the enemy town you may end
up losing trophies.  You should try send out attacks against towns
that you think you can win against rather than pitting your army
against a town that is too well defended.

For advanced strategies for attacking other players, check out the
Stratgies section of the guide.

Building Defenses.name: Building Defenses
sections:
Once you have left newbie protection, it is inevitable that you will
get attacked by other players.  Some players will attack you for
trophies, while others will attack you in order to loot your
resources.  The only way to survive these attacks and protect your
town is to build base defenses.

Defenses come in two varieties.  The first are static base defenses
that will attack anythihng that comes within range.  Cannon and Wizard
Tower are two examples of static defenses.  The second variety of
defenses are traps which activate when an enemy units comes within a
certain radius of the trap.  Unlike static defenses, traps only
activate once per battle and need to be replaced between battles.  In
general, traps cost a lot less than static defenses, but the cost can
accumlate to high number if you need to replace the trap often.

Besides buildings static defenses and traps, you can also build and
upgrade walls in order to protect your town.  Walls provide protection
against melee units and will need to broken down before melee units
can attack the buildings you have behind the walls.  Walls also help
against ranged units since most of the base defenses will outrange the
ranged attacking units.  Besides walls, you can also place other none
essential buildings in front of your static defenses in order to slow
attackers.

From more details concerning base defenses, check out the Defense
Buildings section of the guide.
